content.description: Fun climb, great route to play around on & try different moves (traverse, mantle, gaston, lie back on a fingerwidth crack). 6th bolt is a challenge to get to on lead--those with reach can lean left & hook it, those with less reach may have to climb to the right past the bolt & then come back to it.
content.location: On the left of the feature, first two bolts go straight up the face, then up to the right & jogs slightly back to the left at last two bolts.

content.description: Ok warm-up route, nothing to write home about.
content.location: Route on the right of the feature.

content.description:
Climb up the inner corner to the left of Party Girl.

Fun moves, but mossy/dirty. Deserves more traffic.
content.location: The obvious inner corner to the left of Party Girl.

content.description: To the right of Party Girl are 2 new boltlines not described in the 2nd edition of the guidebook. They share an anchor right near Party Girl's anchor and can be toproped from the Party Girl anchor. Grade of  the left one unknown- it has a roof partway through. Not having climbed it, I'd estimate 5.10. The start is easy & slabby.
content.protection: approx 5 bolts with 2 chain anchors at top

content.description:
To the right of Party Girl are 2 new boltlines not described in the 2nd edition of the guidebook. They share an anchor right near Party Girl's anchor and can be toproped from the Party Girl anchor.

The right one is slabby and easy at the start- crux is in the middle traversing right on a blank face.
content.location: 2nd boltline to the right of Party Girl.

content.description: Starts with the same first few bolts as Siamese Dream, then goes further left.
content.protection: This route is described in the 2nd edition of the Bruce guidebook, but since then, there appears to have been a lot of vegetation growth. There's a small tree that now blocks one of the bolts, so this may no longer be leadable. It shares an anchor with Siamese Dream so at least parts of it (minus the tree) can be toproped after leading Siamese Dream. The book says 13 bolts, but I don't think it is leadable without a weed-whacker.
